item.title: Evelus | Gamma Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:41, topic:410739”][quote author=_s link=topic=512011.msg3718284#msg3718284 date=1313783440]

Doesn’t the Lua interface force you to mess with a stack to compound expressions?

yes

implying runescape private servers require complex calculations

View port calculations are fairly complex, very repetitive. If there are 2000-2048 players on a server, and that calculation is used every cycle then I believe this will be worth investigating.

the overhead from JNI calls every 600ms will probably rape your idea, speed wise.

i do believe we have already gone over this cause some moron suggested it (blakeman iirc)

lazaro & blakeman have suggested it and been laughed at

implying runescape private servers require complex calculations

View port calculations are fairly complex, very repetitive. If there are 2000-2048 players on a server, and that calculation is used every cycle then I believe this will be worth investigating.

the overhead from JNI calls every 600ms will probably rape your idea, speed wise.

i do believe we have already gone over this cause some moron suggested it (blakeman iirc)

We will see, I am not going to say yes or no because I have yet to test it myself. LuaJava uses JNI encapsulation btw

thats why i think it’s going to be a dirty hack

We are just going to write it in C++, calling a method took longer than I wanted. I wasn’t ignoring your comments but I did have to investigate this myself. Thanks for the advice never the less.

this is going to be hilarious considering i’ve never actually seen you use C++ before, you’ve either learnt C++ to a good extent in a very short time (it’s a big language compared to Java and C), you’ve barely learnt it yet believe you can get far with minimal knowledge or you’re getting someone else to do the heavy work.

I don’t have a time frame and I have to learn it eventually, its not that bad in my opinion I just need to learn the style/libraries.

you’ve really underestimated the language (C WITH CLASSES! JAVA WITH MANUAL MEMORY MANAGEMENT!!!), the standard api has nothing networking related so you’ll be fucking around with libraries a lot and not to mention C++ is a pretty complex language when you really dive into some of the hackish, dirty shit you can do with it.

tbh, i honestly recommend you don’t even attempt an rs emulator until you’ve had plenty of experience with C++ (i’m talking months & years) and you’re proficient at software design (personal observations, i’ve never seen you flex your software design skills so i’ll assume they don’t exist), you’ll be wasting your time writing something when you’re inexperienced because it’ll inevitably turn out like turd.

I say its worth a shot, you have to learn somewhere. I can take the next year if I want; make something interesting. I know what I am getting into, I will just move through it and persistently try and come up with new and better ideas.

i hope you didn’t just suggest that you’re going to build the server up as you go along
[/quote]
I believe he did…[/quote]

My partner is trying to persuade me to come back to Java for what he calls ‘Rapid prototyping’ XD
I swing back and forth, I would like to do it in C++ but I know I don’t have enough knowledge in C++ to do it.

Read full topic

the overhead from JNI calls every 600ms will probably rape your idea, speed wise.

We will see, I am not going to say yes or no because I have yet to test it myself. LuaJava uses JNI encapsulation btw

thats why i think it’s going to be a dirty hack

We are just going to write it in C++, calling a method took longer than I wanted. I wasn’t ignoring your comments but I did have to investigate this myself. Thanks for the advice never the less.

this is going to be hilarious considering i’ve never actually seen you use C++ before, you’ve either learnt C++ to a good extent in a very short time (it’s a big language compared to Java and C), you’ve barely learnt it yet believe you can get far with minimal knowledge or you’re getting someone else to do the heavy work.

I don’t have a time frame and I have to learn it eventually, its not that bad in my opinion I just need to learn the style/libraries.

you’ve really underestimated the language (C WITH CLASSES! JAVA WITH MANUAL MEMORY MANAGEMENT!!!), the standard api has nothing networking related so you’ll be fucking around with libraries a lot and not to mention C++ is a pretty complex language when you really dive into some of the hackish, dirty shit you can do with it.

tbh, i honestly recommend you don’t even attempt an rs emulator until you’ve had plenty of experience with C++ (i’m talking months & years) and you’re proficient at software design (personal observations, i’ve never seen you flex your software design skills so i’ll assume they don’t exist), you’ll be wasting your time writing something when you’re inexperienced because it’ll inevitably turn out like turd.

I say its worth a shot, you have to learn somewhere. I can take the next year if I want; make something interesting. I know what I am getting into, I will just move through it and persistently try and come up with new and better ideas.
[/quote]
i hope you didn’t just suggest that you’re going to build the server up as you go along[/quote]
I believe he did…

item.title: Evelus | Gamma Multi-Revision Server
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:24, topic:410739”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=512011.msg3716768#msg3716768 date=1313693158]

Why the hell write it in Lua? What is this? Garrysmod?

you are a fucking moron, lua is used for all sorts of things because it’s easy to implement almost anywhere (although i’ve had bad experiences when using it with C). many games (GMod, WoW) use it for various things.

JNI question: I spoke to Trey about this because I had some concerns that I could not implement some of the features that I wanted with just Java, he suggest JNI even after the fact I was planning to use it.

What kind of fucking features are you trying to implement in a Java-based game the requires JNI?

I can’t say right now because I don’t have it done…yet. I will post when I figure it out/map out how I want everything to work.
[/quote]
Use native code, no idea what you’re using it for… You MUST have a reason why you NEED JNI? If you don’t, then you shouldn’t be using it.[/quote]

Processes mostly, I am experimenting with some aspects of speed. Things are subject to change but I did have to include that I was working with it. Some calculation that I have to do for say, the palette system take long than I would like; I will compare and if it is any more faster than before I will continue to use JNI. I am focusing on the scripting system right now, because that is more important.

Read full topic

item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:21, topic:410739”][quote author=_s link=topic=512011.msg3716722#msg3716722 date=1313690191]

Why the hell write it in Lua? What is this? Garrysmod?

you are a fucking moron, lua is used for all sorts of things because it’s easy to implement almost anywhere (although i’ve had bad experiences when using it with C). many games (GMod, WoW) use it for various things.
[/quote]

JNI question: I spoke to Trey about this because I had some concerns that I could not implement some of the features that I wanted with just Java, he suggest JNI even after the fact I was planning to use it.[/quote]
What kind of fucking features are you trying to implement in a Java-based game the requires JNI?

Read full topic

item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote="_s, post:18, topic:410739"][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=512011.msg3716304#msg3716304 date=1313659795]
Why the hell write it in Lua? What is this? Garrysmod?
[/quote]
you are a fucking moron, lua is used for all sorts of things because it’s easy to implement almost anywhere (although i’ve had bad experiences when using it with C). many games (GMod, WoW) use it for various things.[/quote]

JNI question: I spoke to Trey about this because I had some concerns that I could not implement some of the features that I wanted with just Java, he suggest JNI even after the fact I was planning to use it.
